result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:03 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: S. Bridges. Defendant Austin Matthew Lazaretti appeared by video.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin appeared by video for Austin Matthew Lazaretti.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Set for PHA. Court confirms DE's address. S/T Officer Kerber. Direct by ADA Smested. Cross by Atty. Perrin. Re-direct by ADA Smestad. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court approves DE and Atty. Perrin to appear by Zoom at next hearing. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned 10:24 AM. srb

10:12 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Austin Matthew Lazaretti in court. Court notes DE did not qualify for public defender and did not file PFAC. DE states that he wishes to represent himself. RECESS to allow time for DE to review waiver of counsel form before proceeding. Case recalled. DE states that his employment and income status has changed and he would like to apply for court appointed attorney. Court sets STC for attorney status. Adjourned: 10:22 AM. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial assessment report, filed by JSC.  Reviewed during INIT. bph

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:42 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Austin Matthew Lazaretti appeared by video, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets STC to check status of counsel.  gll
